Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/eint.c

23#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26/* eint1(x) = -gamma - log(x) - sum((-1)^k*z^k/k/k!, k=1..infinity) for x > 0
27 = - eint(-x) for x < 0
28 where
29 eint (x) = gamma + log(x) + sum(z^k/k/k!, k=1..infinity) for x > 0
30 eint (x) is undefined for x < 0.
31*/
32
33/* Compute in y an approximation of sum(x^k/k/k!, k=1..infinity),
34 and return e such that the absolute error is bound by 2^e ulp(y).
35 Return PREC(y) when the truncated series does not converge.
36*/
37static mpfr_exp_t
38mpfr_eint_aux (mpfr_t y, mpfr_srcptr x)
39{
40 mpfr_t eps; /* dynamic (absolute) error bound on t */
41 mpfr_t erru, errs;
42 mpz_t m, s, t, u;
43 mpfr_exp_t e, sizeinbase;
44 mpfr_prec_t w = MPFR_PREC(y);
45 unsigned long k;
46 MPFR_GROUP_DECL (group);
47
48 /* for |x| <= 1, we have S := sum(x^k/k/k!, k=1..infinity) = x + R(x)
49 where |R(x)| <= (x/2)^2/(1-|x|/2) <= 2*(x/2)^2
50 thus |R(x)/x| <= |x|/2
51 thus if |x| <= 2^(-PREC(y)) we have |S - o(x)| <= ulp(y) */
52
53 if (MPFR_GET_EXP(x) <= - (mpfr_exp_t) w)
54 {
55 mpfr_set (y, x, MPFR_RNDN);
56 return 0;
57 }
58
59 mpz_init (s); /* initializes to 0 */
60 mpz_init (t);
61 mpz_init (u);
62 mpz_init (m);
63 MPFR_GROUP_INIT_3 (group, 31, eps, erru, errs);
64 e = mpfr_get_z_2exp (m, x); /* x = m * 2^e */
65 MPFR_ASSERTD (mpz_sizeinbase (m, 2) == MPFR_PREC (x));
66 if (MPFR_PREC (x) > w)
67 {
68 e += MPFR_PREC (x) - w;
69 mpz_tdiv_q_2exp (m, m, MPFR_PREC (x) - w);
70 }
71 /* remove trailing zeroes from m: this will speed up much cases where
72 x is a small integer divided by a power of 2 */
73 k = mpz_scan1 (m, 0);
74 mpz_tdiv_q_2exp (m, m, k);
75 e += k;
76 /* initialize t to 2^w */
77 mpz_set_ui (t, 1);
78 mpz_mul_2exp (t, t, w);
79 mpfr_set_ui (eps, 0, MPFR_RNDN); /* eps[0] = 0 */
80 mpfr_set_ui (errs, 0, MPFR_RNDN); /* maximal error on s */
81 for (k = 1;; k++)
82 {
83 /* let t[k] = x^k/k/k!, and eps[k] be the absolute error on t[k]:
84 since t[k] = trunc(t[k-1]*m*2^e/k), we have
85 eps[k+1] <= 1 + eps[k-1]*|m|*2^e/k + |t[k-1]|*|m|*2^(1-w)*2^e/k
86 = 1 + (eps[k-1] + |t[k-1]|*2^(1-w))*|m|*2^e/k
87 = 1 + (eps[k-1]*2^(w-1) + |t[k-1]|)*2^(1-w)*|m|*2^e/k */
88 mpfr_mul_2ui (eps, eps, w - 1, MPFR_RNDU);
89 if (mpz_sgn (t) >= 0)
90 mpfr_add_z (eps, eps, t, MPFR_RNDU);
91 else
92 mpfr_sub_z (eps, eps, t, MPFR_RNDU);
93 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2 (sizeinbase, m);
94 mpfr_mul_2si (eps, eps, sizeinbase - (w - 1) + e, MPFR_RNDU);
95 mpfr_div_ui (eps, eps, k, MPFR_RNDU);
96 mpfr_add_ui (eps, eps, 1, MPFR_RNDU);
97 mpz_mul (t, t, m);
98 if (e < 0)
99 mpz_tdiv_q_2exp (t, t, -e);
100 else
101 mpz_mul_2exp (t, t, e);
102 mpz_tdiv_q_ui (t, t, k);
103 mpz_tdiv_q_ui (u, t, k);
104 mpz_add (s, s, u);
105 /* the absolute error on u is <= 1 + eps[k]/k */
106 mpfr_div_ui (erru, eps, k, MPFR_RNDU);
107 mpfr_add_ui (erru, erru, 1, MPFR_RNDU);
108 /* and that on s is the sum of all errors on u */
109 mpfr_add (errs, errs, erru, MPFR_RNDU);
110 /* we are done when t is smaller than errs */
111 if (mpz_sgn (t) == 0)
112 sizeinbase = 0;
113 else
114 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2 (sizeinbase, t);
115 if (sizeinbase < MPFR_GET_EXP (errs))
116 break;
117 }
118 /* the truncation error is bounded by (|t|+eps)/k*(|x|/k + |x|^2/k^2 + ...)
119 <= (|t|+eps)/k*|x|/(k-|x|) */
120 mpz_abs (t, t);
121 mpfr_add_z (eps, eps, t, MPFR_RNDU);
122 mpfr_div_ui (eps, eps, k, MPFR_RNDU);
123 mpfr_abs (erru, x, MPFR_RNDU); /* |x| */
124 mpfr_mul (eps, eps, erru, MPFR_RNDU);
125 mpfr_ui_sub (erru, k, erru, MPFR_RNDD);
126 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (erru))
127 {
128 /* the truncated series does not converge, return fail */
129 e = w;
130 }
131 else
132 {
133 mpfr_div (eps, eps, erru, MPFR_RNDU);
134 mpfr_add (errs, errs, eps, MPFR_RNDU);
135 mpfr_set_z (y, s, MPFR_RNDN);
136 mpfr_div_2ui (y, y, w, MPFR_RNDN);
137 /* errs was an absolute error bound on s. We must convert it to an error
138 in terms of ulp(y). Since ulp(y) = 2^(EXP(y)-PREC(y)), we must
139 divide the error by 2^(EXP(y)-PREC(y)), but since we divided also
140 y by 2^w = 2^PREC(y), we must simply divide by 2^EXP(y). */
141 e = MPFR_GET_EXP (errs) - MPFR_GET_EXP (y);
142 }
143 MPFR_GROUP_CLEAR (group);
144 mpz_clear (s);
145 mpz_clear (t);
146 mpz_clear (u);
147 mpz_clear (m);
148 return e;
149}
150
151/* Return in y an approximation of Ei(x) using the asymptotic expansion:
152 Ei(x) = exp(x)/x * (1 + 1/x + 2/x^2 + ... + k!/x^k + ...)
153 Assumes |x| >= PREC(y) * log(2).
154 Returns the error bound in terms of ulp(y).
155*/
156static mpfr_exp_t
157mpfr_eint_asympt (mpfr_ptr y, mpfr_srcptr x)
158{
159 mpfr_prec_t p = MPFR_PREC(y);
160 mpfr_t invx, t, err;
161 unsigned long k;
162 mpfr_exp_t err_exp;
163
164 mpfr_init2 (t, p);
165 mpfr_init2 (invx, p);
166 mpfr_init2 (err, 31); /* error in ulps on y */
167 mpfr_ui_div (invx, 1, x, MPFR_RNDN); /* invx = 1/x*(1+u) with |u|<=2^(1-p) */
168 mpfr_set_ui (t, 1, MPFR_RNDN); /* exact */
169 mpfr_set (y, t, MPFR_RNDN);
170 mpfr_set_ui (err, 0, MPFR_RNDN);
171 for (k = 1; MPFR_GET_EXP(t) + (mpfr_exp_t) p > MPFR_GET_EXP(y); k++)
172 {
173 mpfr_mul (t, t, invx, MPFR_RNDN); /* 2 more roundings */
174 mpfr_mul_ui (t, t, k, MPFR_RNDN); /* 1 more rounding: t = k!/x^k*(1+u)^e
175 with u=2^{-p} and |e| <= 3*k */
176 /* we use the fact that |(1+u)^n-1| <= 2*|n*u| for |n*u| <= 1, thus
177 the error on t is less than 6*k*2^{-p}*t <= 6*k*ulp(t) */
178 /* err is in terms of ulp(y): transform it in terms of ulp(t) */
179 mpfr_mul_2si (err, err, MPFR_GET_EXP(y) - MPFR_GET_EXP(t), MPFR_RNDU);
180 mpfr_add_ui (err, err, 6 * k, MPFR_RNDU);
181 /* transform back in terms of ulp(y) */
182 mpfr_div_2si (err, err, MPFR_GET_EXP(y) - MPFR_GET_EXP(t), MPFR_RNDU);
183 mpfr_add (y, y, t, MPFR_RNDN);
184 }
185 /* add the truncation error bounded by ulp(y): 1 ulp */
186 mpfr_mul (y, y, invx, MPFR_RNDN); /* err <= 2*err + 3/2 */
187 mpfr_exp (t, x, MPFR_RNDN); /* err(t) <= 1/2*ulp(t) */
188 mpfr_mul (y, y, t, MPFR_RNDN); /* again: err <= 2*err + 3/2 */
189 mpfr_mul_2ui (err, err, 2, MPFR_RNDU);
190 mpfr_add_ui (err, err, 8, MPFR_RNDU);
191 err_exp = MPFR_GET_EXP(err);
192 mpfr_clear (t);
193 mpfr_clear (invx);
194 mpfr_clear (err);
195 return err_exp;
196}
197
198/* mpfr_eint returns Ei(x) for x >= 0,
199 and -E1(-x) for x < 0, following http://dlmf.nist.gov/6.2 */
200int
201mpfr_eint (mpfr_ptr y, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
202{
203 int inex;
204 mpfr_t tmp, ump, x_abs;
205 mpfr_exp_t err, te;
206 mpfr_prec_t prec;
207 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
208 MPFR_ZIV_DECL (loop);
209
210 MPFR_LOG_FUNC (
211 ("x[%Pu]=%.*Rg rnd=%d", mpfr_get_prec (x), mpfr_log_prec, x, rnd),
212 ("y[%Pu]=%.*Rg inexact=%d", mpfr_get_prec (y), mpfr_log_prec, y, inex));
213
214 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (x)))
215 {
216 if (MPFR_IS_NAN (x))
217 {
218 MPFR_SET_NAN (y);
219 MPFR_RET_NAN;
220 }
221 else if (MPFR_IS_INF (x))
222 {
223 /* eint(+inf) = +inf and eint(-inf) = -0 */
224 if (MPFR_IS_POS (x))
225 {
226 MPFR_SET_INF(y);
227 MPFR_SET_POS(y);
228 }
229 else
230 {
231 MPFR_SET_ZERO(y);
232 MPFR_SET_NEG(y);
233 }
234 MPFR_RET(0);
235 }
236 else /* eint(+/-0) = -Inf */
237 {
238 MPFR_SET_INF(y);
239 MPFR_SET_NEG(y);
240 MPFR_SET_DIVBY0 ();
241 MPFR_RET(0);
242 }
243 }
244
245 MPFR_TMP_INIT_ABS (x_abs, x);
246
247 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
248
249 /* Init stuff */
250 prec = MPFR_PREC (y) + 2 * MPFR_INT_CEIL_LOG2 (MPFR_PREC (y)) + 6;
251 mpfr_init2 (tmp, 64);
252 mpfr_init2 (ump, 64);
253
254 /* Since eint(x) >= exp(x)/x, we have log2(eint(x)) >= (x-log(x))/log(2).
255 Let's compute k <= (x-log(x))/log(2) in a low precision. If k >= emax,
256 then log2(eint(x)) >= emax, and eint(x) >= 2^emax, i.e. it overflows. */
257 if (MPFR_IS_POS(x))
258 {
259 mpfr_log (tmp, x, MPFR_RNDU);
260 mpfr_sub (ump, x, tmp, MPFR_RNDD);
261 mpfr_div (ump, ump, __gmpfr_const_log2_RNDU, MPFR_RNDD);
262 /* FIXME: We really need a mpfr_cmp_exp_t function. */
263 MPFR_ASSERTN (MPFR_EMAX_MAX <= LONG_MAX);
264 if (mpfr_cmp_ui (ump, __gmpfr_emax) >= 0)
265 {
266 mpfr_clear (tmp);
267 mpfr_clear (ump);
268 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
269 return mpfr_overflow (y, rnd, 1);
270 }
271 }
272
273 /* Since E1(x) <= exp(-x) for x >= 1, we have log2(E1(x)) <= -x/log(2).
274 Let's compute k >= -x/log(2) in a low precision. If k < emin
275 then log2(E1(x)) <= emin-1, and E1(x) <= 2^(emin-1): it underflows. */
276 if (MPFR_IS_NEG(x) && MPFR_GET_EXP(x) >= 1)
277 {
278 mpfr_div (ump, x, __gmpfr_const_log2_RNDD, MPFR_RNDU);
279 MPFR_ASSERTN (MPFR_EMIN_MIN >= LONG_MIN);
280 if (mpfr_cmp_si (ump, __gmpfr_emin) < 0)
281 {
282 mpfr_clear (tmp);
283 mpfr_clear (ump);
284 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
285 return mpfr_underflow (y, rnd, -1);
286 }
287 }
288
289 /* eint() has a root 0.37250741078136663446...,
290 so if x is near, already take more bits */
291 if (MPFR_IS_POS(x) && MPFR_GET_EXP(x) == -1) /* 1/4 <= x < 1/2 */
292 {
293 mpfr_t y;
294 mpfr_init2 (y, 32);
295 /* 1599907147/2^32 is a 32-bit approximation of 0.37250741078136663446 */
296 mpfr_set_ui_2exp (y, 1599907147UL, -32, MPFR_RNDN);
297 mpfr_sub (y, x, y, MPFR_RNDN);
298 prec += (mpfr_zero_p (y)) ? 32
299 : mpfr_get_exp (y) < 0 ? -mpfr_get_exp (y) : 0;
300 mpfr_clear (y);
301 }
302
303 mpfr_set_prec (tmp, prec);
304 mpfr_set_prec (ump, prec);
305
306 MPFR_ZIV_INIT (loop, prec); /* Initialize the ZivLoop controller */
307 for (;;) /* Infinite loop */
308 {
309 /* For the asymptotic expansion to work, we need that the smallest
310 value of k!/|x|^k is smaller than 2^(-p). The minimum is obtained for
311 x=k, and it is smaller than e*sqrt(x)/e^x for x>=1. */
312 if (MPFR_GET_EXP (x) > 0 &&
313 mpfr_cmp_d (x_abs, ((double) prec +
314 0.5 * (double) MPFR_GET_EXP (x)) * LOG2 + 1.0) > 0)
315 err = mpfr_eint_asympt (tmp, x);
316 else
317 {
318 err = mpfr_eint_aux (tmp, x); /* error <= 2^err ulp(tmp) */
319 te = MPFR_GET_EXP(tmp);
320 mpfr_const_euler (ump, MPFR_RNDN); /* 0.577 -> EXP(ump)=0 */
321 mpfr_add (tmp, tmp, ump, MPFR_RNDN);
322 /* If tmp <> 0:
323 error <= 1/2 + 1/2*2^(EXP(ump)-EXP(tmp)) + 2^(te-EXP(tmp)+err)
324 <= 1/2 + 2^(MAX(EXP(ump), te+err+1) - EXP(tmp))
325 <= 2^(MAX(0, 1 + MAX(EXP(ump), te+err+1) - EXP(tmp))).
326 If tmp = 0 we can use the same bound, replacing
327 EXP(tmp) by EXP(ump). */
328 err = MAX(1, te + err + 2);
329 te = MPFR_IS_ZERO(tmp) ? MPFR_GET_EXP(ump) : MPFR_GET_EXP(tmp);
330 err = err - te;
331 err = MAX(0, err);
332 mpfr_log (ump, x_abs, MPFR_RNDN);
333 mpfr_add (tmp, tmp, ump, MPFR_RNDN);
334 /* same formula as above, except now EXP(ump) is not 0 */
335 err += te + 1;
336 if (MPFR_LIKELY (!MPFR_IS_ZERO (ump)))
337 err = MAX (MPFR_GET_EXP (ump), err);
338 /* if tmp is zero, we surely cannot round correctly */
339 err = (MPFR_IS_ZERO(tmp)) ? prec : MAX(0, err - MPFR_GET_EXP (tmp));
340 }
341 /* Note: we assume here that MPFR_CAN_ROUND returns the same result
342 for rnd and MPFR_INVERT_RND(rnd) */
343 if (MPFR_LIKELY (MPFR_CAN_ROUND (tmp, prec - err, MPFR_PREC (y), rnd)))
344 break;
345 MPFR_ZIV_NEXT (loop, prec); /* Increase used precision */
346 mpfr_set_prec (tmp, prec);
347 mpfr_set_prec (ump, prec);
348 }
349 MPFR_ZIV_FREE (loop); /* Free the ZivLoop Controller */
350
351 /* Set y to the computed value */
352 inex = mpfr_set (y, tmp, rnd);
353 mpfr_clear (tmp);
354 mpfr_clear (ump);
355
356 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
357 return mpfr_check_range (y, inex, rnd);
358}
